neighbors.name: Bureau Of Land Management
neighbors.claims: The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) is a federal agency that manages public lands; its Four Rivers Field Office oversees about 1.3 million acres in southwest Idaho [Bureau of Land Management](https://www.blm.gov/office/four-rivers-field-office). Federal BLM lands are exempt from local property taxes, with counties instead receiving Payment in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) funds from the government [U.S. Department of the Interior](https://www.doi.gov/pilt).
neighbors.influence_justification: Federal landowner; no local civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the appropriate BLM field office via official channels.

overview_summary: Of the neighbors identified, none have an explicitly stated stance on development (0 support, 0 oppose, 1 unknown). The sole neighbor is a federal agency rather than a local individual, so there are no high-influence community members in this list.
